account-feature.description: An account feature represents a Heroku labs capability that can be enabled or disabled for an account on Heroku.
account-feature.title: Heroku Platform API - Account Feature

enabled.description: whether or not account feature has been enabled

links.description: Info for an existing account feature.
links.title: Info

account.description: An account represents an individual signed up to use the Heroku platform.
account.title: Heroku Platform API - Account

allow_tracking.description: whether to allow third party web activity tracking

beta.description: whether allowed to utilize beta Heroku features

federated.description: whether the user is federated and belongs to an Identity Provider

last_login.description: when account last authorized with Heroku

name.description: full name of the account owner

new_password.description: the new password for the account when changing the password

self.description: Implicit reference to currently authorized user

two_factor_authentication.description: whether two-factor auth is enabled on the account

verified.description: whether account has been verified with billing information

links.description: Delete account. Note that this action cannot be undone.
links.title: Delete

links.description: Delete account. Note that this action cannot be undone.
links.title: Delete

identity_provider.description: Identity Provider details for federated users.

add-on-action.description: Add-on Actions are lifecycle operations for add-on provisioning and deprovisioning. They allow whitelisted add-on providers to (de)provision add-ons in the background and then report back when (de)provisioning is complete.
add-on-action.title: Heroku Platform API - Add-on Action

links.description: Mark an add-on as provisioned for use.
links.title: Create - Provision

add-on-attachment.description: An add-on attachment represents a connection between an app and an add-on that it has been given access to.
add-on-attachment.title: Heroku Platform API - Add-on Attachment

id.description: unique identifier of this add-on attachment

force.description: whether or not to allow existing attachment with same name to be replaced

name.description: unique name for this add-on attachment to this app

web_url.description: URL for logging into web interface of add-on in attached app context

links.description: List existing add-on attachments for an add-on.
links.title: List by Add-on

links.description: List existing add-on attachments for an app.
links.title: List by App

links.description: Info for existing add-on attachment for an app.
links.title: Info by App

app.description: billing application associated with this add-on
application that is attached to add-on

add-on-plan-action.description: Add-on Plan Actions are Provider functionality for specific add-on installations
add-on-plan-action.title: Heroku Platform API - Add-on Plan Action

label.description: the display text shown in Dashboard

action.description: identifier of the action to take that is sent via SSO

url.description: absolute URL to use instead of an action

requires_owner.description: if the action requires the user to own the app

add-on-region-capability.description: Add-on region capabilities represent the relationship between an Add-on Service and a specific Region. Only Beta and GA add-ons are returned by these endpoints.
add-on-region-capability.title: Heroku Platform API - Add-on Region Capability

supports_private_networking.description: whether the add-on can be installed to a Space

links.description: List all existing add-on region capabilities.
links.title: List

links.description: List existing add-on region capabilities for an add-on-service
links.title: List by Add-on Service

links.description: List existing add-on region capabilities for a region.
links.title: List

add-on-service.description: Add-on services represent add-ons that may be provisioned for apps. Endpoints under add-on services can be accessed without authentication.
add-on-service.title: Heroku Platform API - Add-on Service

cli_plugin_name.description: npm package name of the add-on service's Heroku CLI plugin

human_name.description: human-readable name of the add-on service provider

supports_multiple_installations.description: whether or not apps can have access to more than one instance of this add-on at the same time

supports_sharing.description: whether or not apps can have access to add-ons billed to a different app

add-on.description: Add-ons represent add-ons that have been provisioned and attached to one or more apps.
add-on.title: Heroku Platform API - Add-on

actions.description: provider actions for this specific add-on

config_vars.description: config vars exposed to the owning app by this add-on

name.description: globally unique name of the add-on

provider_id.description: id of this add-on with its provider

web_url.description: URL for logging into web interface of add-on (e.g. a dashboard)

links.description: List all existing add-ons a user has access to
links.title: List by User

links.description: List existing add-ons for an app.
links.title: List by App

links.description: Change add-on plan. Some add-ons may not support changing plans. In that case, an error will be returned.
links.title: Update

app.description: billing application associated with this add-on

app-feature.description: An app feature represents a Heroku labs capability that can be enabled or disabled for an app on Heroku.
app-feature.title: Heroku Platform API - App Feature

enabled.description: whether or not app feature has been enabled

links.description: Info for an existing app feature.
links.title: Info

app-setup.description: An app setup represents an app on Heroku that is setup using an environment, addons, and scripts described in an app.json manifest file.
app-setup.title: Heroku Setup API - App Setup

status.description: the overall status of app setup

failure_message.description: reason that app setup has failed

manifest_errors.description: errors associated with invalid app.json manifest file

overrides.description: overrides of keys in the app.json manifest file

buildpacks.description: overrides the buildpacks specified in the app.json manifest file

env.description: overrides of the env specified in the app.json manifest file

exit_code.description: The exit code of the postdeploy script

links.description: Create a new app setup from a gzipped tar archive containing an app.json manifest file.
links.title: Create

source_blob.description: gzipped tarball of source code containing app.json manifest file

checksum.description: an optional checksum of the gzipped tarball for verifying its integrity

url.description: URL of gzipped tarball of source code containing app.json manifest file

links.description: Get the status of an app setup.
links.title: Info

app-transfer.description: An app transfer represents a two party interaction for transferring ownership of an app.
app-transfer.title: Heroku Platform API - App Transfer

silent.description: whether to suppress email notification when transferring apps

state.description: the current state of an app transfer

owner.description: identity of the owner of the transfer

recipient.description: identity of the recipient of the transfer

app.description: An app represents the program that you would like to deploy and run on Heroku.
app.title: Heroku Platform API - App

repo_size.description: git repo size in bytes of app

slug_size.description: slug size in bytes of app

links.description: List owned and collaborated apps (excludes organization apps).
links.title: List Owned and Collaborated

build_stack.description: identity of the stack that will be used for new builds

build-result.description: A build result contains the output from a build.
build-result.title: Heroku Build API - Build Result

line.description: a single line of output to STDOUT or STDERR from the build.

stream.description: The output stream where the line was sent.

line.description: A line of output from the build.

lines.description: A list of all the lines of a build's output. This has been replaced by the `output_stream_url` attribute on the build resource.

build.description: A build represents the process of transforming a code tarball into a slug
build.title: Heroku Build API - Build

buildpacks.description: buildpacks executed for this build, in order

items.description: Buildpack to execute in a build

output_stream_url.description: Build process output will be available from this URL as a stream. The stream is available as either `text/plain` or `text/event-stream`. Clients should be prepared to handle disconnects and can resume the stream by sending a `Range` header (for `text/plain`) or a `Last-Event-Id` header (for `text/event-stream`).

source_blob.description: location of gzipped tarball of source code used to create build

checksum.description: an optional checksum of the gzipped tarball for verifying its integrity

url.description: URL where gzipped tar archive of source code for build was downloaded.

app.description: app that the build belongs to

buildpack-installation.description: A buildpack installation represents a buildpack that will be run against an app.
buildpack-installation.title: Heroku Platform API - Buildpack Installations

ordinal.description: determines the order in which the buildpacks will execute

update.description: Properties to update a buildpack installation

url.description: location of the buildpack for the app. Either a url (unofficial buildpacks) or an internal urn (heroku official buildpacks).

name.description: either the shorthand name (heroku official buildpacks) or url (unofficial buildpacks) of the buildpack for the app

updates.description: The buildpack attribute can accept a name, a url, or a urn.

links.description: List an app's existing buildpack installations.
links.title: List

collaborator.description: A collaborator represents an account that has been given access to an app on Heroku.
collaborator.title: Heroku Platform API - Collaborator

silent.description: whether to suppress email invitation when creating collaborator

config-var.description: Config Vars allow you to manage the configuration information provided to an app on Heroku.
config-var.title: Heroku Platform API - Config Vars

links.description: Update config-vars for app. You can update existing config-vars by setting them again, and remove by setting it to `null`.

schema.description: hash of config changes  update values or delete by seting it to `null`

links.title: Update

credit.description: A credit represents value that will be used up before further charges are assigned to an account.
credit.title: Heroku Platform API - Credit

amount.description: total value of credit in cents

balance.description: remaining value of credit in cents

code1.description: first code from a discount card

code2.description: second code from a discount card

domain.description: Domains define what web routes should be routed to an app on Heroku.
domain.title: Heroku Platform API - Domain

cname.description: canonical name record, the address to point a domain at

dyno.description: Dynos encapsulate running processes of an app on Heroku. Detailed information about dyno sizes can be found at: [https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/dyno-types](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/dyno-types).
dyno.title: Heroku Platform API - Dyno

attach.description: whether to stream output or not

attach_url.description: a URL to stream output from for attached processes or null for non-attached processes

command.description: command used to start this process

env.description: custom environment to add to the dyno config vars

name.description: the name of this process on this dyno

force_no_tty.description: force an attached one-off dyno to not run in a tty

state.description: current status of process (either: crashed, down, idle, starting, or up)

time_to_live.description: seconds until dyno expires, after which it will soon be killed

event.description: An event represents an action performed on another API resource.
event.title: Heroku Platform API - Event

action.description: the operation performed on the resource

data.description: the serialized resource affected by the event

sequence.description: a numeric string representing the event's sequence

updated_at.description: when the event was updated (same as created)

previous_data.description: data fields that were changed during update with previous values

failed-event.description: A failed event represents a failure of an action performed on another API resource.
failed-event.title: Heroku Platform API - Failed Event

action.description: The attempted operation performed on the resource.

message.example:
Your account reached the API rate limit
Please wait a few minutes before making new requests

method.description: The HTTP method type of the failed action.

path.description: The path of the attempted operation.

resource.description: The related resource of the failed action.

filter-apps.description: Filters are special endpoints to allow for API consumers to specify a subset of resources to consume in order to reduce the number of requests that are performed.  Each filter endpoint endpoint is responsible for determining its supported request format.  The endpoints are over POST in order to handle large request bodies without hitting request uri query length limitations, but the requests themselves are idempotent and will not have side effects.
filter-apps.title: Heroku Platform API - Filters

links.description: Request an apps list filtered by app id.
links.title: Apps

formation.description: The formation of processes that should be maintained for an app. Update the formation to scale processes or change dyno sizes. Available process type names and commands are defined by the `process_types` attribute for the [slug](#slug) currently released on an app.
formation.title: Heroku Platform API - Formation

command.description: command to use to launch this process

id.description: unique identifier of this process type

update.description: Properties to update a process type

updates.description: Array with formation updates. Each element must have "type", the id or name of the process type to be updated, and can optionally update its "quantity" or "size".

identity-provider.description: Identity Providers represent the SAML configuration of an Organization.
identity-provider.title: Heroku Platform API - Identity Provider

certificate.description: raw contents of the public certificate (eg: .crt or .pem file)

entity_id.description: URL identifier provided by the identity provider

id.description: unique identifier of this identity provider

slo_target_url.description: single log out URL for this identity provider

sso_target_url.description: single sign on URL for this identity provider

updated_at.description: when the identity provider record was updated

links.description: Get a list of an organization's Identity Providers
links.title: List

links.description: Create an Identity Provider for an organization
links.title: Create

organization.description: organization associated with this identity provider

inbound-ruleset.description: An inbound-ruleset is a collection of rules that specify what hosts can or cannot connect to an application.
inbound-ruleset.title: Heroku Platform API - Inbound Ruleset

action.description: states whether the connection is allowed or denied

source.description: is the requests source in CIDR notation

rule.description: the combination of an IP address in CIDR notation and whether to allow or deny it's traffic.

links.description: Current inbound ruleset for a space
links.title: Info

links.description: Info on an existing Inbound Ruleset
links.title: Info

links.description: List all inbound rulesets for a space
links.title: List

invitation.description: An invitation represents an invite sent to a user to use the Heroku platform.
invitation.title: Heroku Platform API - Invitation

receive_newsletter.description: whether this user should receive a newsletter or not

invoice-address.description: An invoice address represents the address that should be listed on an invoice.
invoice-address.title: Heroku Vault API - Invoice Address

other.description: metadata / additional information to go on invoice

use_invoice_address.description: flag to use the invoice address for an account or not

links.description: Update invoice address for an account.
links.title: update

invoice.description: An invoice is an itemized bill of goods for an account which includes pricing and charges.
invoice.title: Heroku Platform API - Invoice

period_end.description: the ending date that the invoice covers

period_start.description: the starting date that this invoice covers

state.description: payment status for this invoice (pending, successful, failed)

total.description: combined total of charges and credits on this invoice

key.description: Keys represent public SSH keys associated with an account and are used to authorize accounts as they are performing git operations.
key.title: Heroku Platform API - Key

fingerprint.description: a unique identifying string based on contents

log-drain.description: [Log drains](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/log-drains) provide a way to forward your Heroku logs to an external syslog server for long-term archiving. This external service must be configured to receive syslog packets from Heroku, whereupon its URL can be added to an app using this API. Some add-ons will add a log drain when they are provisioned to an app. These drains can only be removed by removing the add-on.
log-drain.title: Heroku Platform API - Log Drain

id.description: unique identifier of this log drain

token.description: token associated with the log drain

url.description: url associated with the log drain

links.description: Delete an existing log drain. Log drains added by add-ons can only be removed by removing the add-on.
links.title: Delete

log-session.description: A log session is a reference to the http based log stream for an app.
log-session.title: Heroku Platform API - Log Session

id.description: unique identifier of this log session

lines.description: number of log lines to stream at once

source.description: log source to limit results to

oauth-authorization.description: OAuth authorizations represent clients that a Heroku user has authorized to automate, customize or extend their usage of the platform. For more information please refer to the [Heroku OAuth documentation](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/oauth)
oauth-authorization.title: Heroku Platform API - OAuth Authorization

description.description: human-friendly description of this OAuth authorization

scope.description: The scope of access OAuth authorization allows

links.description: Regenerate OAuth tokens. This endpoint is only available to direct authorizations or privileged OAuth clients.
links.title: Regenerate

client.description: identifier of the client that obtained this authorization, if any

user.description: authenticated user associated with this authorization

oauth-client.description: OAuth clients are applications that Heroku users can authorize to automate, customize or extend their usage of the platform. For more information please refer to the [Heroku OAuth documentation](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/oauth).
oauth-client.title: Heroku Platform API - OAuth Client

id.description: unique identifier of this OAuth client

ignores_delinquent.description: whether the client is still operable given a delinquent account

redirect_uri.description: endpoint for redirection after authorization with OAuth client

secret.description: secret used to obtain OAuth authorizations under this client

links.description: Rotate credentials for an OAuth client
links.title: Rotate Credentials

oauth-grant.description: OAuth grants are used to obtain authorizations on behalf of a user. For more information please refer to the [Heroku OAuth documentation](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/oauth)
oauth-grant.title: Heroku Platform API - OAuth Grant

code.description: grant code received from OAuth web application authorization

type.description: type of grant requested, one of `authorization_code` or `refresh_token`

oauth-token.description: OAuth tokens provide access for authorized clients to act on behalf of a Heroku user to automate, customize or extend their usage of the platform. For more information please refer to the [Heroku OAuth documentation](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/oauth)
oauth-token.title: Heroku Platform API - OAuth Token

expires_in.description: seconds until OAuth token expires; may be `null` for tokens with indefinite lifetime

token.description: contents of the token to be used for authorization

authorization.description: authorization for this set of tokens

client.description: OAuth client secret used to obtain token

grant.description: grant used on the underlying authorization

user.description: Reference to the user associated with this token

organization-add-on.description: A list of add-ons the Organization uses across all apps
organization-add-on.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization Add-on

links.description: List add-ons used across all Organization apps
links.title: List For Organization

organization-app-collaborator.description: An organization collaborator represents an account that has been given access to an organization app on Heroku.
organization-app-collaborator.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization App Collaborator

links.description: Create a new collaborator on an organization app. Use this endpoint instead of the `/apps/{app_id_or_name}/collaborator` endpoint when you want the collaborator to be granted [permissions] (https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/org-users-access#roles-and-app-permissions) according to their role in the organization.
links.title: Create

links.description: Delete an existing collaborator from an organization app.
links.title: Delete

links.description: Info for a collaborator on an organization app.
links.title: Info

links.description: Update an existing collaborator from an organization app.
links.title: Update

links.description: List collaborators on an organization app.
links.title: List

organization-app.description: An organization app encapsulates the organization specific functionality of Heroku apps.
organization-app.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization App

locked.description: are other organization members forbidden from joining this app.

joined.description: is the current member a collaborator on this app.

personal.description: force creation of the app in the user account even if a default org is set.

links.description: Create a new app in the specified organization, in the default organization if unspecified,  or in personal account, if default organization is not set.
links.title: Create

links.description: List apps in the default organization, or in personal account, if default organization is not set.
links.title: List

links.description: Lock or unlock an organization app.
links.title: Update Locked

links.description: Transfer an existing organization app to another Heroku account.
links.title: Transfer to Account

links.description: Transfer an existing organization app to another organization.
links.title: Transfer to Organization

organization-feature.description: An organization feature represents a feature enabled on an organization account.
organization-feature.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization Feature

enabled.description: whether or not account feature has been enabled

links.description: Info for an existing account feature.
links.title: Info

organization-invitation.description: An organization invitation represents an invite to an organization.
organization-invitation.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization Invitation

links.description: Get a list of an organization's Identity Providers
links.title: List

links.description: Get an invitation by its token

organization-invoice.description: An organization invoice is an itemized bill of goods for an organization which includes pricing and charges.
organization-invoice.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization Invoice

addons_total.description: total add-ons charges in on this invoice

database_total.description: total database charges on this invoice

dyno_units.description: The total amount of dyno units consumed across dyno types.

platform_total.description: total platform charges on this invoice

period_end.description: the ending date that the invoice covers

period_start.description: the starting date that this invoice covers

state.description: payment status for this invoice (pending, successful, failed)

total.description: combined total of charges and credits on this invoice

weighted_dyno_hours.description: The total amount of hours consumed across dyno types.

organization-member.description: An organization member is an individual with access to an organization.
organization-member.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization Member

created_at.description: when the membership record was created

email.description: email address of the organization member

federated.description: whether the user is federated and belongs to an Identity Provider

name.description: full name of the organization member

two_factor_authentication.description: whether the Enterprise organization member has two factor authentication enabled

updated_at.description: when the membership record was updated

links.description: Create a new organization member, or update their role.
links.title: Create or Update

links.description: Remove a member from the organization.
links.title: Delete

links.description: List the apps of a member.
links.title: List

organization-payment-method.description: The on file payment method for an organization account.
organization-payment-method.title: Heroku Vault API - Organization Payment Method

card_number.description: encrypted card number of payment method

first_name.description: the first name for payment method

last_name.description: the last name for payment method

card_last4.description: last 4 digits of credit card number

links.description: Update an existing payment method for an organization account.
links.title: update

links.description: Get the current payment method for an organization account.
links.title: get

whitelisting-enabled.description: Whether whitelisting rules should be applied to add-on installations

organization.description: Organizations allow you to manage access to a shared group of applications across your development team.
organization.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization

credit_card_collections.description: whether charges incurred by the org are paid by credit card.

default.description: whether to use this organization when none is specified

membership_limit.description: upper limit of members allowed in an organization.

provisioned_licenses.description: whether the org is provisioned licenses by salesforce.

links.description: List organizations in which you are a member.
links.title: List

otp-secret.description: This renders a secret that clients can use to build a one-time password to be supplied as a 2nd factor of authentication.
otp-secret.title: Heroku Platform API - OTP Secret

url.description: OTP secret rendered in URL format

links.description: Create new OTP secret. This invalidates any existing OTP secrets on the account.
links.title: Create

outbound-ruleset.description: An outbound-ruleset is a collection of rules that specify what hosts Dynos are allowed to communicate with.
outbound-ruleset.title: Heroku Platform API - Outbound Ruleset

target.description: is the target destination in CIDR notation

port.description: an endpoint of communication in an operating system.

protocol.description: formal standards and policies comprised of rules, procedures and formats that define communication between two or more devices over a network

rule.description: the combination of an IP address in CIDR notation, a from_port, to_port and protocol.

links.description: Current outbound ruleset for a space
links.title: Info

links.description: Info on an existing Outbound Ruleset
links.title: Info

links.description: List all Outbound Rulesets for a space

password-reset.description: A password reset represents a in-process password reset attempt.
password-reset.title: Heroku Platform API - PasswordReset

reset_password_token.description: unique identifier of a password reset attempt

links.description: Reset account's password. This will send a reset password link to the user's email address.
links.title: Reset Password

payment-method.description: The on file payment method for an account
payment-method.title: Heroku Vault API - Payment Method

card_number.description: encrypted card number of payment method

first_name.description: the first name for payment method

last_name.description: the last name for payment method

card_last4.description: last 4 digits of credit card number

links.description: Update an existing payment method for an account.
links.title: update

links.description: Get the current payment method for an account.
links.title: get

payment.description: A payment represents money collected for an account
payment.title: Heroku Vault API - Payments

uuid.description: unique identifier for a payment transaction

links.description: Create a payment on an existing account
links.title: create

organization-app-permission.description: An organization app permission is a behavior that is assigned to a user in an organization app.
organization-app-permission.title: Heroku Platform API - Organization App Permission

name.description: The name of the app permission.

description.description: A description of what the app permission allows.
description.example: Can manage config, deploy, run commands and restart the app.

pipeline-coupling.description: Information about an app's coupling to a pipeline
pipeline-coupling.title: Heroku Platform API - Pipeline Coupling

links.description: Info for an existing pipeline coupling.
links.title: Info

links.description: Info for an existing pipeline coupling.
links.title: Info

app.description: app involved in the pipeline coupling

pipeline-promotion-target.description: Promotion targets represent an individual app being promoted to
pipeline-promotion-target.title: Heroku Platform API - Pipeline Promotion Target

error_message.description: an error message for why the promotion failed
error_message.example: User does not have access to that app

links.description: List promotion targets belonging to an existing promotion.
links.title: List

app.description: the app which was promoted to

pipeline_promotion.description: the promotion which the target belongs to

release.description: the release which was created on the target app

pipeline-promotion.description: Promotions allow you to move code from an app in a pipeline to all targets
pipeline-promotion.title: Heroku Platform API - Pipeline Promotion

app.description: the app which was promoted from
the app is being promoted to

pipeline.description: the pipeline which the promotion belongs to

app.description: the app which was promoted from

release.description: the release used to promoted from

pipeline.description: A pipeline allows grouping of apps into different stages.
pipeline.title: Heroku Platform API - Pipeline

plan.description: Plans represent different configurations of add-ons that may be added to apps. Endpoints under add-on services can be accessed without authentication.
plan.title: Heroku Platform API - Plan

compliance.description: the compliance regimes applied to an add-on plan

default.description: whether this plan is the default for its add-on service

human_name.description: human readable name of the add-on plan

installable_inside_private_network.description: whether this plan is installable to a Private Spaces app

installable_outside_private_network.description: whether this plan is installable to a Common Runtime app

regime.description: compliance requirements an add-on plan must adhere to

cents.description: price in cents per unit of plan

space_default.description: whether this plan is the default for apps in Private Spaces

rate-limit.description: Rate Limit represents the number of request tokens each account holds. Requests to this endpoint do not count towards the rate limit.
rate-limit.title: Heroku Platform API - Rate Limit

remaining.description: allowed requests remaining in current interval

recovery-code.description: Recovery codes grant access to accounts with two-factor authentication enabled.
recovery-code.title: Heroku Platform API - Recovery Code

links.description: Generate new recovery codes. This invalidates any existing codes on the account.
links.title: Create

region.description: A region represents a geographic location in which your application may run.
region.title: Heroku Platform API - Region

locale.description: area in the country where the region exists

private_capable.description: whether or not region is available for creating a Private Space

release.description: A release represents a combination of code, config vars and add-ons for an app on Heroku.
release.title: Heroku Platform API - Release

description.description: description of changes in this release

version.description: unique version assigned to the release

current.description: indicates this release as being the current one for the app

addon_plan_names.description: add-on plans installed on the app for this release

slug.description: A slug is a snapshot of your application code that is ready to run on the platform.
slug.title: Heroku Platform API - Slug

checksum.description: an optional checksum of the slug for verifying its integrity

commit.description: identification of the code with your version control system (eg: SHA of the git HEAD)

commit_description.description: an optional description of the provided commit
commit_description.example: fixed a bug with API documentation

method.description: method to be used to interact with the slug blob

process_types.description: hash mapping process type names to their respective command

url.description: URL to interact with the slug blob

links.description: Create a new slug. For more information please refer to [Deploying Slugs using the Platform API](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/platform-api-deploying-slugs).

example.commit_description: fixed a bug with API documentation

links.title: Create

blob.description: pointer to the url where clients can fetch or store the actual release binary

sms-number.description: SMS numbers are used for recovery on accounts with two-factor authentication enabled.
sms-number.title: Heroku Platform API - SMS Number

links.description: Recover an account using an SMS recovery code
links.title: SMS Number

links.description: Recover an account using an SMS recovery code

links.description: Confirm an SMS number change with a confirmation code
links.title: Confirm

sni-endpoint.description: SNI Endpoint is a public address serving a custom SSL cert for HTTPS traffic, using the SNI TLS extension, to a Heroku app. Note: only apps with the `http-sni` and `stable-cname` feature flags or those owned by a user with the `user-http-sni` and `user-stable-cname` feature flags are authorized to use this endpoint.
sni-endpoint.title: Heroku Platform API - SNI Endpoint

certificate_chain.description: raw contents of the public certificate chain (eg: .crt or .pem file)

cname.description: canonical name record, the address to point a domain at

id.description: unique identifier of this SNI endpoint

private_key.description: contents of the private key (eg .key file)

source.description: A source is a location for uploading and downloading an application's source code.
source.title: Heroku Platform API - Source

links.description: Create URLs for uploading and downloading source.
links.title: Create

links.description: Create URLs for uploading and downloading source. Deprecated in favor of `POST /sources`
links.title: Create (Deprecated)

source_blob.description: pointer to the URL where clients can fetch or store the source

space-app-access.description: Space access represents the permissions a particular user has on a particular space.
space-app-access.title: Heroku Platform API - Space Access

id.description: unique identifier of the space a user has permissions on

links.description: List permissions for a given user on a given space.
links.title: Info

links.description: Update an existing user's set of permissions on a space.
links.title: Update

links.description: List all users and their permissions on a space.
links.title: List

space-nat.description: Network address translation (NAT) for stable outbound IP addresses from a space
space-nat.title: Heroku Platform API - Space Network Address Translation

created_at.description: when network address translation for a space was created

sources.description: potential IPs from which outbound network traffic will originate

state.description: availability of network address translation for a space

updated_at.description: when network address translation for a space was updated

links.description: Current state of network address translation for a space.
links.title: Info

space.description: A space is an isolated, highly available, secure app execution environments, running in the modern VPC substrate.
space.title: Heroku Platform API - Space

regime.description: compliance requirements a space must adhere to

compliance.description: the compliance regimes applied to a space

ssl-endpoint.description: [SSL Endpoint](https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/ssl-endpoint) is a public address serving custom SSL cert for HTTPS traffic to a Heroku app. Note that an app must have the `ssl:endpoint` add-on installed before it can provision an SSL Endpoint using these APIs.
ssl-endpoint.title: Heroku Platform API - SSL Endpoint

certificate_chain.description: raw contents of the public certificate chain (eg: .crt or .pem file)

cname.description: canonical name record, the address to point a domain at

id.description: unique identifier of this SSL endpoint

preprocess.description: allow Heroku to modify an uploaded public certificate chain if deemed advantageous by adding missing intermediaries, stripping unnecessary ones, etc.

private_key.description: contents of the private key (eg .key file)

rollback.description: indicates that a rollback should be performed

stack.description: Stacks are the different application execution environments available in the Heroku platform.
stack.title: Heroku Platform API - Stack

state.description: availability of this stack: beta, deprecated or public

user-preferences.description: Tracks a user's preferences and message dismissals
user-preferences.title: Heroku Platform API - User Preferences

self.description: Implicit reference to currently authorized user
